issue.title: Added user-friendly error messages for NumberFormatter configuration

body:
I've realized that this is not a bug. You should use `$textOptions` instead of `$options` for that kind of a setting.

But since that is not really clear I think we can make it more user-friendly by adding better messages for the exceptions.

Hmm, yes, when we set `thousandSeparator` we set internally

```
$formatter->setSymbol(NumberFormatter::GROUPING_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL, $this->thousandSeparator);
$formatter->setSymbol(NumberFormatter::MONETARY_GROUPING_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL, $this->thousandSeparator);
```

so both would have to be set, better to just use `thousandSeparator`, that's what it's for.

Edit:
For currency only the second one (MONETARY) is used apparently.

Also in order for `Yii::$app->formatter->thousandSeparator = '_';` to work, i also have to set `NumberFormatter::GROUPING_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL => 1`
I don't really know what this 1 is doing but it does the job ðŸ˜ƒ 
Otherwise i don't get any separation symbol at all.
You mean `NumberFormatter::GROUPING_USED`? Hmm, should we set it as well?

No, i mean `NumberFormatter::GROUPING_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL`
The reason I've tried to put an integer there in the first place is because of the error. I've tried putting **`0`** - no separator is displayed. Then tested with **`1`** and a space appeared as thousands separator (without actually specifying any value for `Yii::$app->formatter->thousandSeparator`)

I've tested it without Yii ( https://3v4l.org/a0nDu ) and looks like in case of currencies attributes are just ignored but most probably it all depends on the ICU version you have installed. I'm afraid we cannot do much about that apart from taking care of the proper error handling which is in my PR.
